name: BlowOut
overview: BlowOut is a 2003 side-scrolling action video game developed by Terminal Reality and published by Majesco Entertainment, released for the GameCube, PlayStation 2, Xbox, and Microsoft Windows. It is a run-and-gun shoot-em-up in the tradition of games such as Contra and Metal Slug, with a power-up-based exploration structure akin to Metroid. In the game, the player takes the role of John "Dutch" Cane, a space marine sent to check up on researchers on the space platform "Honour Guard" only to discover that they have been horribly mutated.
